definition: to sauté/to stir-fry/to speculate/to hype/to fire (sb)

sentences.english: Fry chopped onion in a heavy-based casserole pot with olive oil.
sentences.chinese: 在炒锅中加油和黄油，倒入洋葱，翻炒。

sentences.english: Pour some oil into a frying pan.
Heat up a frying pan with oil. Stir in slices of ginger, onion, garlic, star anise and peppercorns until aromatic.
sentences.chinese: 炒锅入油烧热，将姜葱蒜片，八角和花椒粒入锅爆香。

sentences.english: Heat up a pan with oil until hot. Fry the marinated chicken until golden.
sentences.chinese: 炒锅入适量油烧热，入鸡肉炸至金黄色捞起。

sentences.english: Food cooked in an electric frying pan is very delicious.
sentences.chinese: 用电炒锅做出来的饭菜，味道鲜美。

sentences.english: Place potatoes in a saucepan and cover with cold water.
sentences.chinese: 土豆放在炒锅中，加冷水，加盖，用高火煮开。

sentences.english: Heat the wok and put in the oil and chopped Chinese onions.
sentences.chinese: 把炒锅烧热，放入油和葱花。

sentences.english: Heat oil in pan. On medium heat add potatoes a few slices at a time so they don't stick together.
sentences.chinese: 用炒锅中温热油，依次加入几片土豆翻炒，使不粘连。

sentences.english: Place the diced pancetta in a heated pan and stir-fry until they are crispy.
sentences.chinese: 炒锅加热，放入烟肉丁炒至香脆。

sentences.english: Heat up a skillet with half tablespoon of oil.
sentences.chinese: 烧热炒锅，入半勺沙拉油加热。

sentences.english: Add in more oil into the frying pan and stir in the shrimps and cook for about half minute. Remove.
sentences.chinese: 炒锅内再放入少许油烧热，入虾仁丁翻炒半分钟勺起。

sentences.english: To season your wok, put it on the stove over medium-high heat for a few minutes.
sentences.chinese: 季节您炒锅，把它放在炉子的中型高温几分钟。

definition: to stir-fry in a small quantity of oil
wok with a long handle/wok spatula/ladle
to stir-fry before broiling or stewing
chunks obtained by repeatedly cutting a vegetable diagonally and rotating the vegetable after each cut
see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
